TableContextTimeStampBeforeTable: {106442=2013 has been a big year for Intrepid’s Project SAMA. We have been busy, reaching out to o..., 107761=March 20 is proclaimed as the UN International Day of Happiness. The day recognises the importan...}
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {5322=Singaporean Chilli Crab could be considered one of the world's favourite dishes from this region. Invented back in 1950, chilli crab can now be found everywhere in Singapore - from high-end restaurants to simple hawker stalls.}
textBeforeTable: Recommended reading Further reading 7. Please ask and receive permission before taking photos of people, including children. 6. Refrain from supporting businesses that exploit or abuse endangered animals. 5. Shop for locally made products. Supporting local artisans helps keep traditional crafts alive. 4. Always dispose of litter thoughtfully, including cigarette butts. Littering is taken very seriously in Singapore. 3. For environmental reasons, try to avoid buying bottled water. Fill a reusable water bottle or canteen with filtered water. 2. Dress modestly and respectfully. Shoulders to knees should be covered, especially when entering places of worship. 1. Be considerate of Singapore’s customs, traditions, religion and culture. Top responsible travel tips for Singapore Intrepid is committed to travelling in a way that is respectful of local people, their culture, local economies and the environment. It's important to remember that what may be acceptable behaviour, dress and language in your own country, may not be appropriate in another. Please keep this in mind while travelling. Singapore Travel Tips Responsible Travel also provides useful health
